dt: {bc}the revival of classical {d_link|letters|letter:1}, individualistic and critical spirit, and emphasis on {d_link|secular|secular:1} concerns characteristic of the {d_link|Renaissance|renaissance}
{bc}a doctrine, attitude, or way of life centered on human interests or values

{bc}a philosophy that usually rejects {d_link|supernaturalism|supernaturalism} and stresses an individual's dignity and worth and capacity for {d_link|self-realization|self-realization} through reason {bc}{sx|secular humanism||}

shortdef: devotion to the humanities : literary culture
the revival of classical letters, individualistic and critical spirit, and emphasis on secular concerns characteristic of the Renaissance

dt: {bc}someone who opposes or rejects the beliefs, principles, or assumptions of {d_link|humanism|humanism}

dt.t: {wi}Anti-humanists{/wi} are not necessarily against human beings; they merely assert that a humanistic conception of life is untenable and may be morally dangerous.

utxt.t: … the desire to rescue the concept of agency from the {wi}anti-humanist{/wi} assaults of poststructuralism …
The result is a situation in which even vibrant and worldly artists like Rubens are made over in the sniggering, neurotic image of contemporary {wi}anti-humanistic{/wi} pedantry.
In his frigid {wi}antihumanism{/wi}, Sorokin parts company with Russian satirists like Gogol, Bulgakov, Yuri Olesha and, more recently, Viktor Pelevin.

shortdef: someone who opposes or rejects the beliefs, principles, or assumptions of humanism

dt: {bc}humanism {dx_def}see {dxt|humanism||3}{/dx_def} viewed especially as relying on reason, logic, and naturalism {dx_def}see {dxt|naturalism||2}{/dx_def} as opposed to religious dogma and supernaturalism {dx_def}see {dxt|supernaturalism||2}{/dx_def}

dt.t: Some items on the spiritual person's shopping list are easily supplied by {wi}secular humanism{/wi}. Easiest of all are two that people often find intuitively the most perplexing: how can there be meaning in life and moral values in a world without gods?
{wi}Secular humanism{/wi} was the seeking of a middle way between dogmatic belief in God and militant atheism.
… as the author states, his {wi}secular humanism{/wi} offers a cosmic outlook on the universe and our place in it …

utxt.t: … as a {wi}secular humanist{/wi} she has a moral and ethical belief system that is very similar to those found in many of the great religions. She just doesn't believe in gods, the supernatural, or an afterlife. She is, instead, guided by reason, science, logic and a desire to find a common ground and love, between all people.
[Tim] Madigan says {wi}secular humanists{/wi} can criticize dogma and statements of faith while retaining working relations and friendships with people of many different religious beliefs.
… ethical quandaries faced by those of us who try to maintain a delicate balance between our {wi}secular humanist{/wi} values and our scholarly duties …

shortdef: humanism viewed especially as relying on reason, logic, and naturalism as opposed to religious dogma and supernaturalism
